This control ensures compliance with stricter regulatory requirements.

backup-recovery-procedures.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC (Backup and Recovery), NIST CSF 2.0 PR.DS-11 (Data backups maintained, tested, and documented), and SOC2 TSC A1.3 (Recovery plan procedures established and tested). Essential for business continuity and data integrity.

sox-extended-data-retention.description: Addresses the partial compliance of existing data retention policies. SOX 404 Data Management (Data Retention) and SEC Rule 17a-4 require financial records to be retained for typically 7 years, which the prior 3-year policy failed to meet.

sox-data-integrity-db.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Data Management (Data Integrity) by ensuring the accuracy and completeness of financial data at rest and during processing. This is critical for reliable financial reporting.

pci-cde-traffic-rules-transaction-databa.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 1.2.1 (Define and understand inbound/outbound traffic rules) and CCC-NET-01 (Network segmentation between trust zones) by providing explicit traffic rules for CDE components. This remediates the insufficient detail in the existing global network segmentation control.

This remediates the stated lack of granular access control.

pci-audit-log-retention.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 10.5.1 (Audit log history retained for 12 months) and the 'Top Risk Finding: Insufficient data retention policies' by explicitly mandating 12-month retention for audit logs in the transaction database.

nodes.description: External card network (Visa/Mastercard) for authorization and settlement

third-party-risk-management.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 GV.SC-02 (Cybersecurity supply chain risk management established). Mitigates risks from external dependencies.

nodes.name: Cardholder Data
nodes.description: PCI-DSS scoped cardholder data including PAN, CVV, and expiration date

data-minimization.description: Collect only minimum required cardholder data, never store CVV

data-residency-documentation.description: Addresses CCC-DPP-06 (Data residency and sovereignty controls). Essential for compliance with data protection regulations and demonstrating control over data location.

relationships.description: Customer enters payment information on checkout page
Checkout page submits encrypted payment data to payment API

tls-enforcement.description: Enforce TLS 1.2 minimum with strong cipher suites

relationships.description: Payment API checks transaction for fraud indicators
Tokenization service forwards authorization request to card network

change-management-process.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC (Change Management) and NIST CSF 2.0 PR.PS-01 (Configuration management practices established). Lack of formal change control poses a critical risk to financial reporting integrity.

incident-response-plan.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC (Incident Management), PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 12.10.1 (Incident response plan established and maintained), NIST CSF 2.0 RS.MA-01 (Incident response plan executed), and SOC2 TSC CC7.4 (Security incidents identified and reported). A critical control for maintaining security posture and regulatory compliance.

network-segmentation-cde.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 1.2.1 (Define and understand inbound/outbound traffic rules), NIST CSF 2.0 PR.IR-01 (Networks and environments are protected), and SOC2 TSC CC6.6 (Logical access security measures protect against external threats). Essential for protecting cardholder data by limiting the scope of CDE.

centralized-log-management-retention.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 10.5.1 (Audit log history retained for 12 months). Essential for forensic analysis, incident response, and regulatory compliance.

vulnerability-scanning.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 11.3.1 (Internal vulnerability scans performed quarterly) and NIST CSF 2.0 ID.RA-01 (Vulnerabilities identified, validated, recorded). Critical for proactive identification and remediation of security weaknesses.

penetration-testing-annual.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 11.4.1 (External penetration testing performed annually) and NIST CSF 2.0 ID.RA-01 (Vulnerabilities identified, validated, recorded). Essential for robust security validation.

intrusion-detection-prevention.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 11.5.1 (Intrusion-detection techniques detect intrusions), NIST CSF 2.0 DE.CM-01 (Networks monitored for anomalous behavior), and SOC2 TSC CC7.1 (Infrastructure components monitored to detect anomalies). Crucial for real-time threat detection and response.

organizational-security-policy.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 GV.PO-01 (Cybersecurity policy established and communicated). A foundational control for a robust cybersecurity program.

risk-management-process.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 GV.RM-01 (Risk management objectives established and communicated). Essential for informed decision-making regarding cybersecurity investments and priorities.

mission-aligned-cybersecurity-strategy.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 GV.OC-01 (Organizational mission understood and informs cybersecurity). Crucial for establishing context and ensuring cybersecurity efforts support business goals.

malware-protection.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 DE.CM-04 (Malicious code detected) and SOC2 TSC CC7.2 (Malicious software detected and addressed). Essential for protecting systems from malware infections.

disaster-recovery-plan.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 RC.RP-01 (Recovery plan executed). Crucial for ensuring business continuity.

secure-sdlc.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 6.2.4 (Software engineering techniques prevent vulnerabilities) and related CCC recommendations. Essential for proactively identifying and remediating vulnerabilities in custom code.

sox-access-review.description: Addresses SOX 404 Access Controls (Access Reviews) which requires periodic review of user access rights, a key component of SOX ITGCs. This control ensures continued adherence to least privilege and appropriate access levels.

sox-termination-access-revocation.description: Addresses SOX 404 Access Controls (Termination Procedures) which requires immediate revocation of access for terminated employees. This is crucial for preventing unauthorized access and maintaining data security.

sox-job-scheduling-monitoring.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Operations (Job Scheduling and Monitoring) which requires explicit controls over automated batch processes and error handling for tasks impacting financial reporting. This ensures accuracy and reliability of financial data processing.

sox-capacity-planning.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Operations (Capacity Planning) which requires demonstrating systems can handle expected transaction volumes. Essential for maintaining system availability and integrity of financial operations.

sox-sdlc-code-review.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Software Development (Code Review) by explicitly requiring code review to identify and remediate vulnerabilities before deployment, enhancing the security and integrity of financial systems.

sox-sdlc-version-control.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Software Development (Version Control) by requiring robust version control systems with an audit trail for source code. This ensures traceability and integrity of software changes affecting financial systems.

sox-sdlc-release-management.description: Addresses SOX 404 ITGC Software Development (Release Management) by requiring a controlled and approved process for code promotion to production. This enhances the integrity and stability of financial systems and aligns with the existing 'change-management-process' control.

pci-enhanced-secure-sdlc.description: Addresses PCI-DSS 4.0 Req 6.2.4 (Software engineering techniques prevent vulnerabilities) by providing specific details on implemented secure software engineering techniques. This improves proactive vulnerability identification and remediation.

nist-mission-cybersecurity-alignment.description: Addresses NIST CSF 2.0 GV.OC-01 (Organizational mission understood and informs cybersecurity) by requiring explicit documentation of this alignment. This remediates the lack of demonstrating how the mission informs cybersecurity beyond merely stating the control's existence.

soc2-cde-logical-access-security.description: Addresses SOC2 TSC CC6.1 (Logical access security software, infrastructure, architectures) and SOC2 TSC CC6.6 (Logical access security measures protect against external threats) by mandating comprehensive logical access security for the CDE. This remediates the stated lack of granular access control and insufficient protection against external threats.

soc2-user-registration-authorization.description: Addresses SOC2 TSC CC6.2 (New internal and external users registered and authorized) by establishing formal processes for user access, a critical component of logical access security.

soc2-capacity-usage-monitoring.description: Addresses SOC2 TSC A1.1 (Current processing capacity and usage monitored) by implementing architecture-wide monitoring for capacity and usage. This enhances service availability and operational oversight.

sox-formal-change-management.description: Addresses the critical deficiency in formal change management per SOX 404 ITGC (Change Management) and NIST CSF 2.0 PR.PS-01 (Configuration management practices established). This ensures controlled and auditable changes to critical financial systems.
